content.description: This is the first climb that you come to at the Ginger Wall. Begin at an arete with a series of side pulls on the right side. Lie back past two bolts. Move slightly left and clip two more bolts to a slightly steep finish. Clip the chain anchors from good ledges.
content.protection: 4 Quickdraws plus two for the anchor. Rappel or lower off with a 60m or less.
content.location: Look for 4 bolts to a chain anchor. Left most right on this wall.

content.description: This climbs a more direct 3-bolt start into Burning Bush. Start righ, in front of tree and step up and left past optional hand size cam to reach the line of bolts up the steep wall.  Limb past these to merge into the end of Burning Bush.
content.protection: Bolts. Optional cam at start and above bolt 3.

content.description: Start in a very short corner/crack feature and climb up to a line of 4 bolts leading through the steep wall. Big powerful moves on well-spaced but positive holds make this a challenging climb. Lower from anchors in the capstone.
content.location: Right of Hand in the Bush

content.description: A fun and surprisingly challenging climb. Climb past 3 bolts on good holds to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Rightmost line on the orange/red section of wall

content.description: Begin in the left facing dihedral. Plug a few larger pieces of gear to protect the dihedral. After reaching the first ledge, reach left to clip the first bolt. Traverse left to the arete and make a few techy moves to reach the next bolt. Continue moving up the face and arete to the last bolt. Pull out of the roof and clip the anchors up and left.
content.protection: A single #2 or #3 camalot for the start. Longer sling to keep it running smooth, 3 quickdraws, and 2 draws for the anchor. Rappel with a 50m or 60m rope.
content.location: This climb lies on the far right side of the Ginger Wall. An obvious wide left facing dihedral marks the start.

content.description:
Technically, this is still a project, and I probably will not have a chance to redpoint before leaving the area. Should be a straightforward send with only a brief (albeit hard) crux at the top.

 Climb the steep face past 3 bolts to a blank and reach-dependent move at the top. This one may have you airborne...
content.location: About 100 yards left of the main Ginger Wall. This is the lefthand line.

content.description: Climb the arete on amazing holds past 3 bolts to a short hard crux at the top. Step right here and pull the boulder problem crux past one more bolt and mantel onto ledge to anchor.
content.location: About 100 yards left of the main Ginger Wall. Look for the clean arete next to a chimney.

content.description: Same start as Burning Bush - climb the dihedral up to a # 2 camalot, but instead of going right pull the roof directly above past 2 bolts to a stance. Place a small cam and continue up past a wide section (optional # 4 camalot) to a bolt above. Make funky moves up blocky terrain to the anchor.

Hero climbing at its finest. A great warmup for the nearby harder climbs. Start in the short right facing flake/dihedral feature. Move up and right past a horizontal that takes a #2 camalot (or stick clip 1st bolt). Traverse right to the first bolt. Take an enjoyable ride for the next 35' of some spectacular horizontal jugs to a roof. Pull the roof with a bolt and clip the anchors to the right.
content.protection: 5 bolts and an optional #2 camalot, plus two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is in the middle of the wall at an obtuse arete with jugs that scream "climb me"!

content.description: This beautiful orange (ginger) colored wall is host to a dozen high quality climbs all in the 15m range. Most of the routes are vertical to slightly overhanging with a good mix of grades from 5.8-5.11+. A few of the routes require some gear. The cliff faces W to WNW and gets afternoon sun in the warmer months. The rock here is bullet hard and very clean. A 5.10-5.11 climber could probably spend an entire day here.
